WHILE CHRISTMAS IS BEING MANUFACTURED IN HALLOWEENLAND, I

dialogues.speaker: AN OLD-FASHIONED CALENDAR,
dialogues.text: the kind that used to hang in offices in the forties.  Ea is a tear-off page.  The dates are printed in bold black lettering. The pages of days of the year zip off -- at a rate faster the eye can really register.  The impression should be of whizzing by... Over this, SANTA CLAUS narrates....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Twas a long time ago, quite a bit to be fair In a place that I'm sure you are quite unaware. For our story that you are about to be told Began in the holiday worlds of old. Without holidays, goodness, how dull life would be Without their distraction and pleasure and glee. The calendar makes a SUDDEN STOP AT CHRISTMAS. The calendar page peels back to reveal the first hint of the black and white of the year.  Smoke curls up from the of a snow-covered cottage in a clearing of a snow-covered forest.  THE STOP IS ONLY FOR A BEAT. Then the calendar speeds on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But our holidays are the result of much fuss And hard work for the worlds that must make them for us The calendar STOPS again.  This time at VALENTINE'S DAY. This stop is short, but longer than the last -- as each subsequent stop will be. In Valentine-ville, FAT CUPIDS shoot arrows at distant ch dripping hearts: target practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, each holiday town works all year to create Twenty-four special hours, fantastically great. Soon the calendar whirls on.  Next STOP is

dialogues.speaker: EASTER
dialogues.text: where it is spring.  CACKLING HENS sit side-by-side on th row of nests.  In unison, choreographed like some ballet, lay their pre-decorated eggs. The eggs then drop down a chute and land on a conveyor be carries them out ot the henhouse and into waiting Easter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fleeting twenty-four hours take long to prepare, A full year of planning and plenty of care. But now getting back to the story at hand I should mention THIS POINT about holiday lands -- The calendar flips to the FOURTH OF JULY. FIREWORKS. -- ABE LINCOLN fires a cannon.  The cannonball explodes m showering down the word, "HAPPY." -- BETSY ROSS uses a SPARKLER to write the word, "FOURTH. -- PAUL REVERE sets off the first of six rockets.  Rocket erupts into an "O."  #2 traces an "F" -- together they re Rocket #3 won't light.  Neither will #4, #5, or #6.  Paul panicks. But PAUL REVERE'S HORSE saves the day.  He kicks off his horseshoes -- shooting them at the side of a wooden fence they hit the boards each becomes a letter: "J," "U," "L,"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For each one, way back when, was alas unaware Of the others' existence, now I've said it -- so there! The calendar pages tear on, slowing at October 29, slowin at, and stopping at the 31st.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But once there occurred a calamity SO GREAT! When two of the worlds did collide by mistake... The october 31st page peels back to... nothing.  To BLACK fall in, or perhaps it should feel more like we're swallo TITLE SEQUENCE. Carved JACK O'LANTERNS come at us in the long tunnel of d Collision seems inevitable, but in the instant before we slam into them, the jack o'lanterns veer off, turning to the various credits on their uncarved backsides. When the last jack o'lantern zooms toward us, it doesn't off.  It keeps coming and fast.  Rather than collide with though -- we fall straight into one of the PUMPKINHEAD'S OUT, TRIANGULAR EYES into the further black there and out

dialogues.speaker: A CRYPT DOOR
dialogues.text: which opens onto the EXT. HALLOWEENLAND CEMETERY. NIGHT. The bloated orange disk of the MOON illuminates Halloween delicately decrepit graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ON PUMPKINHEAD,
dialogues.text: giant jack o'lantern head now set on the squat vines of h leafy legs.  He looks more like a spider than like anythi as he scuttles across the cemetery toward the big pumpkin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys and Girls of every age Wouldn't you like to see something strange? Come with us and you will see... This our town of Halloween!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pumpkinhead has reached the

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN PATCH
dialogues.text: where he drops down among his fellow pumpkins -- who all at once -- sudden jack o'lantern mouths and eyes glowing the chorus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Halloween, this is Halloween! Pumpkins scream in the dead of night -- This is Halloween, everybody make a scene Trick or treat 'til the neighbors gonna die of fright!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the graveyard lies the little city of odd expressi angles and the morbid extravaganza of Gothic manses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our town.  Everybody scream. In this town of Halloween...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We swoop down the street, through the creaky iron gate of EXT. DESERTED GOTHIC MANSE. NIGHT/CONTINUOUS TIME. We enter THROUGH A BROKEN, COBWEB-CLOGGED WINDOW into... INT. DESERTED GOTHIC MANSE. NIGHT/CONTINUOUS TIME. Many CREATURES hide in the shadows of this creepy house. camera finds them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the one hiding under your bed, Teeth ground sharp and eyes glowing red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the one hiding under your stairs Fingers like snakes and spiders in my hair.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MANSE'S DECAYED PARLOR,
dialogues.text: every item of furniture that could conceivably serve as a springs open -- the grandfather clock, the window seat, t the chaise longe, the hearth rug (covering a trap door), drawers of a sideboard and out pop CORPSES. The Corpses sit bolt upright and heartily sing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Halloween, this is Halloween, Halloween...(etc)

dialogues.speaker: THE MANSE'S FALLING DOWN FRONT HALL
dialogues.text: is tenuously illuminated by a tarantula chandelier which to the ceiling overhead and lowers and rises according to whims of its web.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR BIG VAMPIRES
dialogues.text: lumber in from the dark, slanty hallways that fan off the entrance hall.  They march in and, in formation, march OU FRONT DOOR onto the ruins of--

dialogues.speaker: EXT. WORM-ROTTED FRONT PORCH. NIGHT/CONTINUOUS TIME
dialogues.text: The Vampires' bodies are huge, but their heads are small insect heads and the voices that come out of heads are li squeaky and high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this town, we call home, Everyone hail to the pumpkin song!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they sing they march down the rickety steps.  Out on t EXT. STREET. NIGHT/CONTINUOUS TIME. A HEARSE passes the Manse.  Riding on top is the corpulen of Halloweenland.  Not surprisingly, he's a TWO-FACED SOR GUY, revealed as each of his faces sings a line:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this town, don't we love it now Everybody's waiting for the next surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the hearse turns a

dialogues.speaker: CORNER
dialogues.text: and glides past an ALLEY we hear a GRAVELLY VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Round that corner, man, Hiding in a trashcan Something's waiting now to pounce and how you'll--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lid flies off of a trashcan and out pops the GRAVELLY TRASHCAN-DWELLING MONSTER.  He's fat and slimy and grotes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Scream!  This is Halloween, Red 'n black, slimy green... Aren't you scared?  Well, that's just fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITCHES speed toward us on their brooms -- zipping out of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it once, say it twice, Take the chance and roll the dice Ride with the moon in the dead of night (oh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the street, the witches fan out and swoop past the

dialogues.speaker: HANGING TREE,
dialogues.text: a gigantic oak with SEVERAL HANGED MEN dangling from its outspread branches. The hanging tree itself sings:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody scream, everybody scream In our town of Halloween.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hanged men suddenly revive:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Halloween, This is Halloween...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LUMPEN-LOOKING LONG-HAIRED WOMAN IN HEELS hurries away tortuously windy street.  This is SALLY.  For now, we see her backside, her waist-length hair. Behind her, and closer to us, a GHOUL tips into view to demonstrate his particular talent:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the guy with the tearaway face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally hesitates, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here in a flash and gone without a trace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally is about to turn around, but as the ghoul vanishes, continues on her way.  We follow her. In a moment, a SECOND GHOUL sets upon her -- this one mor gruesome than the last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the who when you call --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ghoul is closer, louder and Sally does turn around n revealing that she's a crudely stitched together Bride Of Frankenstein Rag Doll.  Her balance is precarious.  Her a flop.  Her mouth is a tragic slash.  She has a quavering, voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the second ghoul has disappeared before she sees him. his voice remains...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the wind blowing through your hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Invisible fingers lift Sally's long hair.  It is with pat eagerness that she looks around for whomever is responsib this.

dialogues.speaker: A THIRD GHOUL
dialogues.text: springs into view, then bounces skyward.  With a very disappointed Sally (she's sorry he's leaving), we watch h into... EXT. SKY. NIGHT/CONTINUOUS TIME. The Third Ghoul seems to reach the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the shadow on the moon at night, filling your dreams to the brim with fright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Third Ghoul passes the orange disk of the moon,

dialogues.speaker: BATS
dialogues.text: flap out from behind it.  They sing with the Third Ghoul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Halloween, This is Halloween HALLOWEEN!  HALLOWEEN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bats flutter off and the Third Ghoul falls back towar ground.  He lands... EXT. HALLOWEEN TOWN SQUARE. NIGHT/CONTINUOUS TIME. As he hits the ground, the Third Ghoul shatters, breaking into several pieces -- globular and doughy GELATINOUS LUM a separate little creature.  When they sing, they have ve voices:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tender Lumplings everywhere Life's no fun without a good scare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the crest of the hill, behind the town square,

dialogues.speaker: THE CORPSES
dialogues.text: march into view, flanking the MAYOR'S HEARSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our job, but we're not mean In our town of Halloween.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the corpses come the VAMPIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this town --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAYOR blares out his message through a P.A. SYSTEM on the hears

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- don't we love it now? Everyone's waiting for the next surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WITCHES come next...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skeleton Jack might catch you in the back and Scream --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gelatinous Lumps instantly reasemble to form the Thir Ghoul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- like a banshee make you jump --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Third Ghoul immediately bounces out of sight again...

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: stumbles into view, still hurrying.  She sings with every else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Halloween, --

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: excitedly spots someone coming -- though he's still out o for us:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Everyone scream, won't ya Please make way for a special guy...

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHERS
dialogues.text: turn to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our man Jack is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- King of the Pumpkin Patch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone hail to the Pumpkin King now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They part to make way for

dialogues.speaker: JACK SKELLINGTON, THE PUMPKIN KING,
dialogues.text: astride his SKELTON HORSE, boots set backwards in the sti is done for the honored dead.  Jack is tall, long-limbed bone-thin.  He is formally attired, and wears an elegant tie. Sally gapes tragically at Jack.  But he rides right past noticing her. Accompanying Jack are most of the CREATURES AND MONSTERS met, the various inhabitants of Halloweenland.  Everyone falls in behind Jack -- including a stumbling, almost-lef behind-gawking Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Halloween, THIS IS HALLOWEEN (etc.)

dialogues.speaker: THE HANGING TREE
dialogues.text: hurries to join the parade.  He brings up the rear.  The MEN bobble on their ever-tightening nooses, their tongues eyes popping out. The tighter nooses make the Hanged Men's voices reed-thin high -- contrasting to the enormous Hanging Tree's lone b profundo:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this place we call home Everyone hail to the Pumpkin Song

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Jack Skellington is demonstrative and very excitable with that are extraordinarily high and lows that are unusually Right now he is surrounded by his ADMIRERS -- the witches particular fawn over him.  Jack seems eager to please eve but, at the same time, a bit anxious to get on with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally watches htm longingly from the edge of the circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jack, you are such a scream! (turns to the assembly) Isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assembly agrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make sparks fly, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make oil boil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make rats shriek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make flesh crawl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three witches try to outdo one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly adds) ...And wounds suppurate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you, thank you very much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last witch glares triumphantly at her cronies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an inspiration to everybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (echoes) An inspiration...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was our most horrific Halloween ever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally sighs and starts to drift irresistibly toward Jack. Throughout, rag doll Sally gains substance as she gains conviction -- this is her first baby step toward that, no perceptible, but in any case RUDELY INTERRUPTED BY --

dialogues.speaker: THE EVIL SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: who created her.  He takes ahold of her by one of her sti together arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deadly nightshade you slipped me wore off, Sally... I thought I'd find you here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally pulls back, trying to wriggle free of the scientist grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have it then if you must!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With her other hand, she quickly and deftly rips out the that attach her arm to the rest of her ... THEN RIPS THE CLEAR OUT OF ITS SOCKET. SHE LEAVES THE DOCTOR HOLDING IT WHILE SHE RUNS OFF into crowd, determined to elude the Evil Scientist.  She disap into the gloom in the direction of the cemetery. Shaking her torn-off arm, the Evil Scientist calls after

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be back.  Sooner or later you'll need this.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: continues to congratulate and be congratulated by the var citizens of Halloweenland.  The Mayor interjects, looking attention--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next year'll even be better, you'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think so, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I do.  It always is, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to get on it immediately.  No time for sitting around smugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so true...  We've got a lot of work ahead of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, everybody! Goodnight, Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assembly breaks up.  Jack turns to leave but his path blocked by A COUPLE OF ADORABLY HIDEOUS KID MONSTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (plead) Just one more time, Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack rattles his bones once more for the kids.  They shri gleeful shriek and scamper off.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE CORNER OF THE TOWN SQUARE,
dialogues.text: Jack passes a STREET BAND -- fellow skeletons down on the an ACCORDION PLAYER, A SAX PLAYER, AND A VIOLINIST.  He t coin into their hat.  Playing, they nod their thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Utterly dejected, Sally crouches behind a tombstone.  She herself with her remaining arm.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUDDEN SOUND OF SOMEONE APPROACHING, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: makes her freeze.  She dares to peek over the top of the tombstone to see who it is -- IT'S JACK. The sight of him immediately comforts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... it's Jack...  Look at him -- he's so alive... So happy... He's so filled with confidence he could teach the wolves to howl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally lets out a little whimper of self-pity and collapse sight behind the tombstone to feel sorry for herself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll never notice me.  Why would he?  Why should he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally hugs herself again -- as best she can with her one

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: makes his way past the markers and mausoleums.  He looks and, since Sally is hidden behind the tombstone, he doesn anyone.  He starts the long climb up Cemetery Ridge as he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are few who'd deny, at what I do I am the best For my talents are renowned far and wide

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it comes to surprises in the moon-lit night, I excel without ever even trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the slightest little effort of my ghost-like charms I have seen grown men give out a shriek

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the wave of my hand, and a well-placed moan, I have swept the very bravest off their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pauses a moment, as if letting these facts settle in heaves a huge sigh and sags miserably. Jack's ghost dog, ZERO, rises out of his grave, floats ov Jack and circles around him.  Trying to comfort his belov master, he drapes himself over Jack's shoulder and lays a sympathetic head on him. Hunched over with sorrow, Jack drags his bones on up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet year after year, it's the same routine And I grow so weary of the sound of screams

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I, Jack, the PUMPKIN KING! Have grown so tired of the same old thing....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero drifts sadly to the ground, and flattens faithfully his master -- only his shiny little jack o'lantern nose o end of his pointy snout sticks up. Jack tragically reaches the crest of the long hill.  Zero follows, dragging along the ground after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh somewhere deep inside of these bones An emptiness began to grow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something out there far from my home A longing that I've never known ... I've never known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack gazes hopelessly out over Halloweenland.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HER TOMBSTONE,
dialogues.text: Sally can't believe what she's hearing.  She peeks, but h again.  She listens breathlessly as Jack continues his soul-searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a master of fright, and a demon of light And I'll scare you right out of your pants, boy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To a guy in Kentucky, I'm Mister Unlucky And I'm known throughout England and France, boy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And since I am dead, I can take off my head To recite Shakespearian quotations

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No animal or man can scream like I can With the fury of my recitations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But who here would ever understand That the Pumpkin King with the skeleton grin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would tire of his crown -- if they only understood He would give it all up if he only could

dialogues.speaker: SALLY'S
dialogues.text: heart goes out to Jack.  She had no idea he felt this way idea of his tragic side.  She wants to show him that he's alone as he thinks, that she understands him.  But she's should she come out from behind the tombstone?  Dare she Should she?  Shouldn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there's an empty place in my bones That calls out for something unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fame and praise, come year after year, Does nothing for these empty tears ... these empty tears....

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: heads off with Zero, staggering away blind in his misery, while...

dialogues.speaker: SALLY,
dialogues.text: still crouched behind the tombstone, continues to debate herself... Jack has left the cemetery and disappeared from sight whe finally screws up her courage and pops up full of determi and shouts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK!  I KNOW YOU HARDLY KNOW ME, BUT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He isn't there to hear her...  Shocked and disappointed, rag doll body goes floppy again. Her voice gets high and tiny... then trails off, almost tearfully...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I feel the same way you do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally stares sadly into the empty spot Jack so recently o then turns and hobbles limply away.  She stops at a

dialogues.speaker: WEED-CHOKED AND DESICCATED LITTLE HERB GARDEN
dialogues.text: set beside a cluster of tombstones at the edge of the gra The herbs growing there are labelled: "Henbane," "Witch H "Deadly Night Shade." As best she can with her single arm, Sally gathers fresh of Deadly Night Shade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost in his private tragedy, Jack lurches heedlessly forw Looking around confused -- they've never been here before floats quickly after, hurrying to catch up.  Whimpering, Jack's coattails and pulls -- trying his best to get Jack stop, to turn around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pulls free. Trying again, Zero grabs Jack by the leg, wrapping his mo around Jack's skinny shin bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No playing today, Zero... I'm just not in the mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero lets go and Jack marches wretchedly forward.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: drops in the fresh sprigs of the herb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarmed, Sally screws the lid back on -- as quickly as sh with only one arm -- and hides the jar at the back of a c

dialogues.speaker: THE EVIL SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: is a twisted silhouette in the doorway behind Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gasping guiltily, Sally spins around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up Sally's torn-off arm -- as well as a large sh needle threaded with a long strand of thread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I tell you?  I'm always right, you know, my dear... Aren't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling his mad grin, the scientist gestures into the roo him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes way for Sally. After a beat, Sally nods.  Resigned, she trudges past him He jauntily follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Evil Scientist carefully sews Sally's arm back on -- the stitches are crude and the fit awkward.  The expressi her face is more tragic than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mine, you know.  I made you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you went away, what would become of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm grown up now.  I have to leave some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you do, and I want you to... but there's no need to hurry it along, is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's twice this month you've slipped Deadly Night Shade into my tea and run off.  People might get the wrong idea and think you're unhappy at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally whimpers sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do the best I can to make it comfortable for us here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I guess my best just isn't good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As anxious as she is to be away from here, Sally can't be thought of hurting anybody and instinctively tries to mak feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.  It's a beautiful home, wonderfully comfortable... I'm indebted to you for everything... It's just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just me, I suppose...  I'm restless.  I can't help it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scientist smiles, feeling Sally under his sway again. pats her consolingly, then finishes sewing on her arm and an elaborate knot at the end of his stitches.  He snips t thread and puts away his sewing kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a phase, my dear.  It'll pass.  We need to be patient, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally heaves a big sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks off tragically.  Outside, it's sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FOREST. DAWN.
dialogues.text: Still bowed by the depth of his despair, unaware of time, distance, or anything, Jack wanders through the gloom of forest.  Zero floats protectively at his side. Suddenly, Jack is stabbed by a ray of light from the risi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cringing, he stops in his tracks.  When he dares to look him, it is as though he has just been woken up from a dre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero barks his haunted ghost bark.  Jack seems to notice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero!  Where are we?  We've never been here, have we, boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack takes a few steps one direction and looks curiously, few steps in another direction and looks -- and looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's some place new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero circles Jack, whirling him around, trying to aim him toward home.  But Jack resists.  He wants to see whatever is to see. He proceeds deeper into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor's hearse pulls up in front of Jack's tower.  Th climbs out, arms brimming with blueprints and plans.  He to Jack's door -- his self-confident face on -- and bangs knocker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits for an answer.  There isn't any.  Even this litt of suspense brings out the Mayor's other face -- this one scared, self-doubting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack?!  You home?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's still no answer. The mayor squints out into the street.  Clearing his thro barks confidently at PASSERS-BY:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to various passers- by) Have you seen Jack?...  Have you seen Jack?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But nobody has.  He doesn't bother to ask the Street Band across the street. The mayor's bravado face evaporates and the whiny one tak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?  We had an appointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His blustery face back on, the Mayor shouts up to Jack's the top of the tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack?!  I've got the plans for next year!  See?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up the blueprints and plans he carries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to go over them with you so we can get started! Halloween'll be here again in no time!  Three hundred and sixty odd days fly by too fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor's faces alternate in progressively rapid succes panic sets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts desperately) Jack!  Please!  I'm only an elected official here!  I can't make decisions!  Jack!  Answer me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruined, the Mayor crumples. The ACCORDION PLAYER of the Street Band says quietly from the street:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hasn't been home all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor tries to rouse himself, but he's shorted out, exhausted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feebly) Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops again to the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally peers out of an upper-storey window -- expression e despairing at once.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FOREST. DUSK.
dialogues.text: It is just before night.  Jack strides forward toward a

dialogues.speaker: DISTANT PUMPKIN SHAPE
dialogues.text: that seems to be carved out of the dark and outlined by g light. Jack can't wait to find out what it means, but Zero, wari his master and far less enthusiastic about this adventure behind. Arriving at the Pumpkin shape, Jack eagerly reaches out t When he touches it, it gives -- CREAKING OPEN to more woo beyond.  It's a DOOR. Zero hurries to catch up as Jack steps through the Pumpki Door and out into a

dialogues.speaker: CLEARING
dialogues.text: in this next forest.  Awed, Jack stops dead in the middle clearing and gapes at what he sees -- there are

dialogues.speaker: MORE DOORWAYS
dialogues.text: etched into the trunks of the trees that ring the clearin us, these doorways make sense -- one is shaped like an EA EGG, another like a FIRECRACKER, another like a VALENTINE another like a SHAMROCK, and another like a CHRISTMAS TRE Jack, who's never heard of the other holidays, these door a total mystery. He is especially TRANSFIXED by the CHRISTMAS TREE-SHAPED DOOR. It rattles invitingly on its hinges.  Gusts of cold air b from behind it.  Snow oozes out beneath.  The drama of it Jack closer. Zero hesitates in the Pumpkin-shaped doorway, uneasy abou crossing through it to the other side -- but the sight of striding resolutely toward the Christmas Tree-shaped door him swoop quickly after. Using all his strength, Jack wrenches open the Christmas shaped door.  There is a moment's delay -- darkness, stil silence -- then the instantaneous fury of a HOWLING BLIZZARD. A quick blast of snow knocks Zero clear back through the shaped doorway. The whipping winter wind curls around Jack's frail bones SUCKS HIM IN THROUGH THE OPEN DOOR.  Jack disappears.  Th Christmas Tree-shaped door SLAMS SHUT. After a beat: Zero pokes his head up over the lintel of the Pumpkin-sha doorway and sees that Jack has vanished.  Panic-stricken, streaks across the clearing to the closed Christmas Tree Crying, he scratches on the door, tries to squeeze under vaporous body is easy, but his head and jack o'lantern no another matter), circles the tree, investigates for anoth entrance (above, below, every which way).  He tries every his ghost-dog powers to get in -- but all in vain.  He ha choice but to wait.  Ears cocked, he settles down to star stare at the strange door that swallowed his master....

dialogues.speaker: THE WHIRLING, SNOW-SWIRLING TUNNEL OF BLACKNESS
dialogues.text: through which Jack FALLS.  The fall abruptly ends.  BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits up in the snow bank where he has landed.  He lo excitedly around.  He marvels first at the miracle of sno

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?  What's this? There's color everywhere... What's this? There's white things in the air... What's this? I can't believe my eyes I must be dreaming, Wake up, Jack, this isn't fair... What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cavorts excitedly in the snow, slipping and sliding an finally tumbling down a hill into the center of Christmas He springs up, shakes himself off, and enthusiastically e the snow-blanketed village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?  What's this? There's something very wrong... What's this? There're people singing songs... What's this? The streets are lined with Little creatures laughing, Everybody seems so happy, Have I possibly gone daffy...? What is this...?  What's this? There're children throwing snowballs Here instead of throwing heads. They're busy building toys And absolutely no one's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here in Christmastown, every tree is a Christmas tree and house is shinier and more beautifully decorated than the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's frost on every window, Oh, I can't believe my eyes, And in my bones I feel a warmth That's coming from inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack peeks into warmly-lighted homes...  Jack uses his co Halloween trickster skills to see without being seen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, look, what's this? They're hanging mistletoe... They kiss -- Why that looks so unique... Inspired! They're gathering around to hear a story, Roasting chestnuts on a fire...  What's this? What's this?  In here They've got a little tree... how queer! And who would ever think... and why? They're covering it with Tiny little things, they've got Electric lights on strings, and there's a Smile on everyone, so now Correct me if I'm wrong... This looks like fun, This looks like fun, Oh, could it be I got my wish...?  What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters the CHILDRENS' cozy BEDROOM in one house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my, what now? The children are asleep...  But look -- There's nothing underneath...  No ghouls No witches here to scream and scare them ... or ensnare them... Only cozy little things Secure inside their dreamland...  What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distracted, Jack goes off to leave the child at whom he h peering suddenly wide awake and terrified... Jack is back outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monsters are all missing And the nightmares can't be found And in their place there seems to be Good feeling all around... Instead of screams I swear I can hear Music in the air. The smell of cakes and pies Is absolutely everywhere... The sights, the sounds, They're everywhere and all around... I've never felt so good before... The empty place inside of me is filling up I simply cannot get enough. I want it, oh, I want it... Oh, I want it for my own. I've got to know I've got to know What is this place that I have found? WHAT IS THIS???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack darts this way and that and runs and runs, trying to fill of this strange new wonderful place. He trips and falls and starts to roll and as he rolls he snow -- he becomes a gigantic snowball barrelling through Christmas town, stopping only when he SLAMS INTO ONE OF TWO GIGANTIC CANDY CANES... between which spans a sign.  Jack bursts out of his snow only to have fresh snow dumped on him which falls from th between the two tall candy canes. Jack shakes himself free of this fresh heap of snow, look the wide welcoming sign: CHRISTMASTOWN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And thoughtfully reads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .... Christmastown?  Hmmmmmmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack studies the town from this distance -- the lights gl heart-warmingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible.  I'll need proof...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his feet again, he slinks quietly back toward Christma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A number of the worried citizens of Halloweenland have ga They chatter among themselves.  The MAYOR addresses them top of his hearse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet.  Quiet now.  We all agree that two days is far too long for Jack to have been gone without warning...  Is there anywhere we've forgotten to check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked in every mausoleum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in unison) We opened the sarcophagi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tromped through the Pumpkin Patch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I peeked behind the Cyclops' eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other citizens wheel around to look at him disbelievi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) I did!... (then adds sadly) But he wasn't there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to sound the alarms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, the alarms wail in the distance while, inside, S speedily whips up a pot of sleeping-potion soup. She keeps looking out the window, hoping for a hint of wh going on, but nothing -- not a clue.  Eager to find out, hurries the soup along... Various spice jars are out on the counter -- among them, labelled "Deadly Night Shade," the entire contents of whi dumps into the pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself) Regular dose...  Double dose... Double, double dose.  He'll be able to smell a double, double dose of Deadly Night Shade... Anybody could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She studies the other jars and picks the one labelled "Fr Breath."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frog's Breath will overpower any smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the jar.  Recoiling from the odor, she turns as trying to escape the fumes as she pours some of the Frog' into the soup -- but it starts to overwhelm her anyway. swoons.  Her knees buckle. In her swoon, she fumbles blindly among the other jars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choking) Sweet Pea...  Where's that Sweet Pea...  Too bitter... Too bitter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hand finally locates the jar labelled, "Sweet Pea." The Evil Scientist calls from another room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still choking, hardly able even to squeak out an answer, struggles to open the Sweet Pea jar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my soup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally finally gets the jar open.  As fast as she can, she it into the soup and hovers above the pot.  In a moment, Sweet Pea takes effect and Sally's strength begins to ret

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasps) Coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still a bit shaky, Sally reaches for one more jar.  The l this one reads, "Worm's Wart."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarsely) A handful of Worm's Wart just for distraction.  It'll throw him off the trail for sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drops in some Worm's Wart, stirs the soup, then ladle bowlful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Evil Scientist is at his lab table, peering into a mi and thinking -- which, for him, involves lifting off the his skull and tickling and scrambling the brains inside. Sally carries in a tray holding his bowl of soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scientist impatiently gestures her over.  He replaces of his skull...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.  Over here.  Over here.  Set it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gingerly sets the tray in front of him. The scientist inhales a deep sniff of the steam curling o soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...  What's that?...  Worm's Wart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances suspiciously at Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What trail are you trying to throw me off now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stammers; feigns innocence) Nothing.  W-w-what are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scientist pushes the bowl of soup toward Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taste it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why?  It's your lunch. There isn't much there in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taste it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry. (acts all hurt) What's wrong?  I spent all morning on that soup.  I thought you liked Worm's Wart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing more suspicious than Worm's Wart -- it distracts one from every other taste and smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dips a spoon into the soup then holds it up to Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until you taste it, I won't eat a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally crumples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have to go out. Something's happening out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, it's none of your concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves the spoon at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps her lips closed tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lapses into self-pity mode) Then we'll both starve...  An old man like me, who hardly has strength as it is -- me, without whom... me, your own father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you make other creations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could.  Of course I could. But no one would be like you... (pours it on again) I'll never understand how you can be so cold-hearted, how you can treat me this way, discarding me like--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It works.  He wears Sally down:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts) All right...  All right... I'll eat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes and sips the soup off the spoon.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TOWN SQUARE. DUSK.
dialogues.text: The Mayor lies sprawled on top of his hearse, staring up sky for ideas.  He's exhausted, as are the assembled citi Halloweenland, exhausted from exhausting their alternativ it comes to seeking Jack. The Mayor lifts his heavy head and feebly asks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did anybody think to dredge the lake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A recumbent corpse sits up and nods:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corpse flops down again. The mayor lets his head fall back.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DISTANCE,
dialogues.text: there's a BARK (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a DEEP RUMBLING (O.S.) can just be heard -- punctuate another sharp BARK (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ssh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They listen.  More RUMBLING.  DEFINITE BARKS NOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Zero?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds get louder, closer... The group revives.  The mayor sits up.  Before long...

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE CORNER
dialogues.text: comes an ecstatic Jack driving a jaunty, Christmasland SN MOBILE, heavily laden with Christmasland memorabilia.  A Zero loops-the-loop around his master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!  It's Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'M BACK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Halloweenland citizens gape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where've you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait to tell all of you all about it! (to the Mayor) Mayor!  Call us a town meeting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor's hearse glides through town, p.a. system blari

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Town meeting!  Town meeting tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse passes the DESERTED GOTHIC MANSE. Out stream the Creatures, Corpses, and other Vampires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the hearse passes and the announcement is heard, the GRAVESTONES open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse threads through town past the EVIL SCIENTIST'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally and the Evil Scientist are both asleep -- the Evil scientist snores, his head on the lab table beside the no bowl; Sally has fallen asleep on her way through the door hat on, arm half-way into the sleeve of her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Town meeting!  Town meeting tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither of them hears the announcement.  Neither of them Their deep sleep goes on undisturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town hall is a tilted Chautauqua meetinghouse.  We HE noise of the crowd inside and see a few Halloweenland lat hurry in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands at a podium on a stage at the end of the big hall.  Set up beside him is a table piled high with (at t point) non-descripit objects. The murmuring crowd presses close to the stage.  Of cours and the Evil Scientist are absent. Jack holds up his hands for attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen everyone.  I want to tell you about where I've been!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sings:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were objects so peculiar They were not to be believed All around things to tantalize my brain. It's a world unlike anything I've ever seen And as hard as I try... I can't seem to describe Like a most improbable dream... But you must believe when I tell you this It's as real as my skull, and it does exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turning to sort through the objects on the table, Jack sp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here...  Let me show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people press even closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhh....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack holds up a wrapped gift:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a thing called a present. The whole thing starts with a box...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A box? --        Is it steel? --                     Are there locks? -- Is it filled with a pox? --                          A pox! -- How delightful, a pox!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack interrupts their excited babbling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you please!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sings on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a box with bright colored paper And the whole thing topped with a bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A bow? --        But why? --                  How ugly! -- What's in it? --                What's in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the point of the thing, not to know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It's a bat. --              Will it bend? -- It's a rat. --              Will it break? -- Perhaps it's the head that I found in the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen now, you don't understand. That's not the point of Christmasland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack shakes his finger at them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, pay attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a Christmas stocking off his display table and s again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we pick up an oversized sock... And bang it like this on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The irrepressible crowd bubbles over again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Oh yes, does it still have a foot? -- Let me see... --                Let me look... -- Is it rotted and covered with gook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is getting very frustrated:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But to no avail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Small toys? --             Do they bite? --                           Do they snap? -- Or perhaps they just spring out and Scare girls and boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor struts to the front of the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a splendid idea -- This Christmas sounds fun. Why I fully endorse it! Let's try it at once!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But doubt immediately overtakes the Mayor as Jack express exasperation with the way things are going...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone, please, now not so fast. There's something here that you don't quite grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confident face evaporating, the Mayor skulks off. Jack looks down at the faces tipped up toward him -- in t expressions, puzzlement replaces eagerness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Well, I may as well give them what they want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack picks up his song again -- the showman once more:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the best, I must confess, I have saved for the last For the ruler of this Christmasland... Is a fearsome king with a deep mighty voice Least, that is what I've come to understand. And I've also heard it told That he's something to behold Like a lobster, huge and red... And sets out to slay with his raingear on, Carting bulging sacks with his big great arms... That is, so I've heard it said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listening to this, the people of Halloweenland are absolu spellbound, rapt, and quiet for a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on a dark, cold night Under full moonlight He flies off into a fog Like a vulture in the sky... And they call him -- Sandy Claws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this conclusion, a delightful shudder runs through the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OOOOH....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They erupt into giddy chatter. Jack watches them from the stage, then turns to his displ and begins gathering up his many Christmasland souvenirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sings wistfully to himself) Well, at least they're excited, But they don't understand That special kind of feeling ... In Christmasland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack shakes a Frosty the Snowman paper weight and dreamil watches the little snowflakes drift down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh well....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sighing, he packs his treasures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack happily decorates his room with the Christmasland so -- He festoons the electric chair with boughs of holly an sprig of mistletoe atop the confining head cap. -- He tosses wreaths around the necks of the gargoyles th down from corners of the ceiling. -- He ties a red bow on Zero.

dialogues.speaker: LATER,
dialogues.text: in bed, snuggled down, wearing a nightcap, his pile of Ch books beside him, Jack gazes critically around his room. over-bright with electric lights -- they're strung everyw they can be strung.  Tinsel sparkles glaringly. Lips pursed, Jack climbs out of bed to pull a string of l out behind an obscuring cobweb, then isn't satisfied just them, but traces the intricate pattern of the cobweb with He steps back for perspective, comes forward to make an adjustment, steps back to look again...  He frowns.  He s his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not quite right; something's wrong... But what?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He paces and looks, paces and looks -- but the mystery re mystery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still suffering the effects of her own sleeping potion, a disheveled Sally drags through the house. The DOORBELL RINGS (O.S.). Sally turns sluggishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly) Who could that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuffles toward it.

dialogues.speaker: INT. EVIL SCIENTIST'S FRONT DOOR. DAY/MOMENTS LATER.
dialogues.text: Sally drags open the front door.  There, on the front sto her utter astonishment stands JACK. He has on a cheery face, but it is obvious to her that he disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice little) Y-you don't have to say that. You don't need to pretend.  Not with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks quizzically at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the doctor in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls) Who is it, Sally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answering for her, Jack strides right in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls to the doctor) It's Jack Skellington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls) Jack!  What a surprise, my boy, a rare pleasure indeed.  Come on back... I'm in the laboratory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack heads back.  Sally looks tragically after.

dialogues.speaker: INT. JACK'S TOWER. DUSK.
dialogues.text: Jack intently sets up a make-shift laboratory with equipm borrowed from the Evil Scientist -- a microscope, mortar pestle, petri dishes, a centrifuge, test tubes, beakers a filled with steaming liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sally shuffles timidly into the room, the scientist do look up from his reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurts) Jack Skellington was here this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scientist nods without looking up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stayed a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scientist nods again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he left, he took a lot of equipment with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's conducting experiments of his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Experiments?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly afraid for Jack, Sally wheels around and stumble

dialogues.speaker: HALL
dialogues.text: and UP THE RICKETY STAIRS.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SALLY'S ROOM. NIGHT/MOMENTS LATER.
dialogues.text: Sally rushes in and hurries across to her window.  She st tip-toe and strains to peer out.  In the distance, betwee other buildings, she can just MAKE OUT A CORNER OF JACK'S TOWER. A strange glow emanates from there. Sally stares for a long time, biting her lip with worry, decisively: Sally turns to her desk.  She takes out a piece of paper pen and writes, reading aloud as she goes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Doctor...  Please don't come after me again.  Please let me go this time.  I am all grown up and need to find my own life now.  I hope you will understand, some day at least. Signed -- Sally.  P.S. I'll come visit very soon.  P.P.S. There's fresh soup in the 'fridge.  P.P.P.S. It isn't spiked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She adds some x's and o's to the bottom of the letter, th it on the pillow of her bed where the doctor will be sure it. She takes a needle and spool of thread out of her drawer, them into her dress, then without warning,

dialogues.speaker: JUMPS OUT HER WINDOW
dialogues.text: with suicidal abandon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally lands on the street outside -- sprawled, torn apart stuffing flowing out, stitches burst. In a moment, she flops upright.  She pulls out the needle thread, threads the needle and, glancing every so often o shoulder at the Evil Scientist's house, hurriedly proceed herself back together again. The job done.  She stashes the needle and thread and wobb stitches are looser than the doctor's) gets to her feet t only she's sewed one of her legs on backwards -- so that takes a step, her legs walk in opposite directions and sh right over. She lets out a little moan of frustration.  Swivelling, s back at the house, afraid of getting caught... She works even faster now, ripping out the stitches on th she replaced backwards and basting it back on facing forw These stitches are really huge and ungainly.  Still, they substantial enough to allow her to get to her feet and to away, though limping rather badly.

dialogues.speaker: INT. JACK'S TOWER. SUNRISE.
dialogues.text: Jack has worked through the night and continues to work, concentrated, intent, doing his methodical best to study Christmas. -- He stares at an image of Sandy Claws he's drawn on the chalkboard -- with giant red lobster hand and elaborate raingear -- then erases it. -- He leafs back and forth through the Christmas books, e often stopping briefly on an image -- RUDOLF, THE RED-NOS

dialogues.speaker: "THE STOCKINGS ARE HUNG BY THE CHIMNEY WITH CARE."
dialogues.text: -- He scrapes a little bit of the shininess off a Christm ball.  With a mortar and pestle, he grinds the flake of s to a sparkling powder, then sprinkles the powder over him if it were fairy dust.  He strikes a pose and waits -- bu transformation occurs.  In another beat, he turns back to work table, freshly determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooner or later this Christmas will yield up its secrets to me.  I'll crack it!  I will!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- He studies a strand of tinsel under the microscope.  I reflects his own hollow eye socket back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiding in the shadows of the building across the street, stares up at Jack's room. She pulls back out of sight once -- when the Evil Scienti passes, obviously looking for her -- but steps out again as he's gone. Other citizens of Halloween look up at Jack's windows as pass and shake their heads with concern, but only Sally k vigil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands at the chalkboard where he's scribbled elabor formulae: Good Cheer + Roasting Chestnuts + Sandy Claws = Christmas Fun.  Sugar Plums + Christmas trees + Rudolf, t Nosed Reindeer = Christas Fun.  Presents + Mistletoe + Sn = Christmas Fun.  If A = B and B = C and A = C, then what

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: He feverishly crosses out some phrases, corrects others, substitutes, modifies.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. JACK'S TOWER. DUSK.
dialogues.text: Using a pulley, Sally surreptitiously hoists up a basket

dialogues.speaker: A TOY STEAM ENGINE
dialogues.text: now chugs along tracks laid around the perimeter of Jack' Puffing smoke, it hauls a string of open cars filled with Christmas dolls and toys.  Jack adds more toys as the tin cars pass him. He looks up at the ODD SCRAPING SOUND of Sally's food bas knocking against the window.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE WINDOW,
dialogues.text: he unhooks the basket and lifts it in.  Inside is dinner, lovingly wrapped in a napkin -- a skeleton chicken, a cou apple cores, and a cold bottle of newt juice. Jack leans

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: to see who sent this to him.  His gaze locks with Sally's below.  A beat.  He nods his thanks.  She waves -- slowly tragic sympathy.  He pulls back into his tower.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND,
dialogues.text: Sally keeps staring faithfully up at Jack's window.

dialogues.speaker: IN HIS TOWER,
dialogues.text: Jack dances around a Christmas tree, giddily tossing on decorations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally is back at her post across the street, watching

dialogues.speaker: JACK'S WINDOW
dialogues.text: where a TALL CANDLE BURNS. AS IF IN TIME-LAPSE, the candle burns all the way down wh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally sleeps curled in the doorway across the street.  Sh to

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL CROWD
dialogues.text: gathering beneath Jack's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly sing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's up with Jack, something's up with Jack... A THIRD VAMPIRE adds his voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know if we're ever going to get him back. Flanked by two corpses, a SLATHERING BEAST lumbers up, si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all alone up there, locked away inside... The CORPSE on his right joins in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never says a word... Then BOTH CORPSES and the beast sing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... hope he hasn't died...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the whole crowd sings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's up with Jack... ... Something's up with Jack... ... Something's up with Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally stays back, separate from the crowd, silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands in the center of his room, a demon possessed, surrounded by Christmas mayhem -- the glittery decoration toys and books strewn all about him. He sings:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmastime is buzzing in my skull. Will it let me be?  I cannot tell. There're so many things I cannot grasp... When I think I've got it, then at last Through my bony fingers it does slip Like a snowflake in a fiery grip. Something's here I'm not quite getting Though I try, I keep forgetting Like a memory long since past Here in an instant, gone in a flash... What does it mean?  What does it mean? In these little bric-a-brac, A secret waiting to be cracked. These dolls and toys confuse me so... Confound it all -- I love it though! Simple objects nothing more But something's hidden through the door. Though I do not have the key, Something's there I cannot see. What does it mean?  What does it mean? I've read these Christmas books so many times I know the stories and I know the rhymes I know the Christmas carols all by heart... My skull's so full, it's tearing me apart. As often as I read them, something's wrong... So hard to put my bony finger on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thought strikes Jack.  He takes a new tack...  He whirl around, singing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or perhaps it's really not as Deep as I've been led to think. Am I trying much too hard...? Of course!  I've been too close to see! The answer's right in front of me! It's simple really, very clear, Like music drifting in the air Invisible but everywhere. Just because I cannot see it Doesn't mean I can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enthusiasm takes the place of torment.  Joy lightens Jack tortured soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I think this Christmas thing -- It's not as tricky as it seems. And why should they have all the fun? It should belong to anyone... Not anyone, in fact, but me! Why, I could make a Christmas tree. And there's no reason I can find That I couldn't handle Christmastime. I bet I could improve it too! And that's exactly what I'll do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack hurries to the window and throws it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts out) EUREKA!

dialogues.speaker: BELOW,
dialogues.text: the crowd is relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile up at their beloved Skeleton Jack.  All except Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly to herself) Oh Jack...  Now what fever has engulfed you?  Your poor sensitive mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally stares up at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LINE of waiting Halloweeners extends out the entrance d The word, 'Christmas,' buzzes in the air. Sally stands in line with everyone else -- somewhere near back, just behind the members of the Street Band.  She pr what she's going to say to Jack when it's her turn --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers almost inaudibly to herself) Jack, you must let go of this insanity.  Don't make this mistake.  Taking over Christmas is no way to fill the gaping hole you feel inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally cowers as she hears the Mayor call:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. FINKELSTEIN TO THE FRONT OF THE LINE!  DR. FINKELSTEIN, STEP RIGHT INSIDE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally ducks out of sight behind the FURRY BEHEMOTH in bac as the

dialogues.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: hobbles by.  Looking for Sally, he peers through his pinc the faces he passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts again) DR. FINKELSTEIN!  WE'RE LOOKING FOR DR. FINKELSTEIN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Evil Scientist hobbles through the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the hall is Jack. To one side of him is his Christmas treasure trunk filled brim with dolls and toys and decorations. On the other side, the Mayor sits at a table.  Before him open scroll -- a long list.  With his raven feather pen, Mayor enthusiastically marks off items and occasionally s notes: forging ahead with the making of Christmas, he and are giving out assignments to the citizens of Halloweenla At the moment, Jack discusses dollmaking with a COUPLE OF VAMPIRES...  One of the vampires cradles an example of a in the palm of his hand.  As he rocks it, its eyes close lying down, but open when it's brought upright.  The doll cries -- bleating sadly. The Vampires make a face at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of noise is that for a baby to make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other vampire shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you handle it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can improve it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vampires scurry off, still studying the babydoll -- l for other improvements. Jack turns to the Evil Scientist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor -- just the man I wanted to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pulls a book out of his trunk.  He leafs through it PICTURE OF SANTA'S REINDEER hooked up to the sleigh and s Evil Scientist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need some of these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Evil Scientist peers closely at the picture of the re in Jack's book, making quick calculations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These...?  Their construction should be very simple, I think.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAYOR
dialogues.text: bellows again, practically in the Evil Scientist's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. FINKELSTEIN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps) Right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor glares at him resentfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor makes a big show of checking off the doctor's n Next, three mischievous Trick Or Treaters scuttle up to t Mayor's table.  They are small but insidious.  Profession Their names are LOCK, SHOCK & BARREL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here!  You sent for us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specifically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor announces the little Trick Or Treaters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oogie Boogie's Boys to see you, Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Evil Scientist shuffles off with the book. The Mayor studies his list again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a smashing success our Christmas will be!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack waves Lock, Shock & Barrel over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a very important, very delicate job for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come close and huddle before him.  Jack whispers his they titter, half-whispering themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three little Trick Or Treaters tip-toe out, still tit and whispering.  They sing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidnap Mr. Sandy Claws...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna do it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Let's draw straws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack said we should work together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three of a kind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Birds of a feather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now and forever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Weeee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They scoot out of sight around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock, Shock & Barrel head toward their digs out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidnap the Sandy Claws, Lock him up real tight Throw away the key and then Turn off all the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First we're going to set some bait Inside a nasty trap and wait. When he comes a-sniffing we will Snap the trap and close the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  I've got a better plan To catch this big red lobster man. Let's pop him in a boiling pot And when he's done we'll butter him up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock, Shock & Barrel arrive at the ominous stinking place

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidnap the Sandy Claws Throw him in a box Bury him for ninety years And then see if he talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Mr. Oogie Boogie Man Can take the whole thing over then. He'll be so pleased I do declare That he will cook him rare...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They zip down the cellar stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weeee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dank, crumbling stairs lead to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once in their corner of the dungeon, the little Trick Or start to gather the things they'll need to do their job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say that we take a cannon Aim it at his door and then Knock three times and when he answers Sandy Claws will be no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so stupid, think now -- If we blow him up to smithereens, We may lose some pieces and then Jack will beat us black and green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidnap the Sandy Claws Tie him in a bag Throw him in the ocean And then see if he is sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a bone-chilling stirring in the next room.  All the little Trick or Treaters react.  As one, they shoot o the corner furthest away from the sounds and lower their

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because Mr. Oogie Boogie Is the meanest guy around, If I were on his Boogie list, I'd get out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be so pleased by our success That he'll reward us too I bet. Perhaps he'll make his special brew Of snake and spider stew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MMMMMMM...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're his little henchman And we take our job with pride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do our best to please him, And stay on his good side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish my cohorts weren't so dumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the dumb one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and listen...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other two stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got something, listen now, This one is real good, you'll see. We'll send a present to his door Upon there'll be a note to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now in the box, we'll wait and hide Until his curiosity Entices him to look inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we'll have him, one, two, three!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fully exuberant again, they gleefully collect their last necessities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidnap the Sandy Claws, Beat him with a stick. Lock him up for ninety years And see what makes him tick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head back up their cellar steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three Trick or Treaters race through a deserted lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidnap the Sandy Claws, Tie him in a knot Put him in a coffin, How we'd like to see him rot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock, Shock & Barrel skip among the tombstones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidnap the Sandy Claws. Chop him into bits Mr. Oogie Boogie is Sure to get his kicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock, Shock & Barrel head for the forest that Jack wander through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidnap the Sandy Claws. See what we will see, Lock him in a cage And then throwaway the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the very edge forest -- they are still in the one step ahead, it is dark and gloomy. Lock, the natural-born leader of the three, stops in his in the last possible light.  The other two bump into him, succession.  Then all three crouch down at once.  Beat. Simultaneously giggling, they suddenly streak forward int woods and, in a moment, are swallowed up into the PITCH-BLACK. The only evidence of them left is the sound of their gigg The giggles recede, then fade...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TOWN HALL. DUSK.
dialogues.text: No part of the line stands outside now.  The few citizens still waiting for assignments stand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very anxious Sally stands at the head of the line, in a going over and over what she intends to say:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost inaudibly) Jack, you must let go of this insanity...  This is a mistake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind her the Furry Behemoth waits patiently.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: works with the Street Band.  Demonstrating, he shakes a h piece studded with sleigh bells.  The bells jingle cheerf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Now you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The members of the Band rattle their bones in response -- legs and arms, echoing the jingle of the bells, but with own distinctive hollow CLANK. Jack laughs, enormously pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect!...  Now let's try this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using various jingling bells, Jack shakes out the tune to Bells." The Band clanks the tune right back -- phrase for phrase.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: watches with an increasing sense of doom as her turn with nears. Jack heartily shakes hands and back-slaps the three membe the street band.  They head off practicing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls after) Thanks!  You're the absolute best!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Sally -- who stands frozen, wide-eyed, her he wild bird trapped in the cage of her chest.  He smiles encouragingly at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  I've saved a really special job for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures for her to step closer. Stiffly, she does.
