dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidentially) I want you to be the one who makes my Sandy Claws outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks stunned.  Jack nods eagerly and pats her, mista silence for awe at the responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enthusiastically proceeds to describe the costume:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bright red, the reddest red you can imagine -- both the jacket and the pair of pants... The boots are black.  There's a big black belt that goes around the middle...  Oh, and there's white trim on the cuffs and collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swallowing hard, Sally looks up at him, her wide eyes moi voice is tiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack suddenly looks confused.  He stops mid-gesture --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brow furrowing, he stares at the ceiling and thinks. Sally holds her breath, hoping... Finally, Jack shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... the trim is traditionally white from everything I've studied, but if you think green would give it more dash...  I trust your judgement.  I know you'll do a great job.  Whatever you decide!

dialogues.speaker: AT THAT MOMENT,
dialogues.text: Lock, Shock and Barrel race in dragging behind them a big with something squirming inside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack!  Jack!  We caught him! We've got him!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: strides excitedly to meet them, leaving Sally.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: flees, mortified, miserable.  She had hoped to help Jack, spare him the pain of his enterprise, to save him from hi Floppy and weak (her legs lost some stuffing in her jump Evil Scientist's window), she runs as best she can, arms pinwheeling...

dialogues.speaker: LOCK, SHOCK
dialogues.text: in a frenzy of giggling, open the big sack and who should out but the EASTER BUNNY. Jack's face drops.  He turns on the three Trick Or Treate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud) That's not Sandy Claws!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder) Not Sandy Claws!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three shrink back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We followed your instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went through the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...In the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which door!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WELL, TAKE HIM BACK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns to the Easter Bunny and speaks loudly and slow him, hoping to be understood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry for the inconvenience, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scowls at the three Trick Or Treaters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I send somebody else for Sandy Claws?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get it right this time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- for sure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you -- there's more than one door!  Sandy Claws is behind the door shaped like this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up a cut-out of a Christmas tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stuff the Easter Bunny back into the sack and hurry

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts after them) Take him home first.  And apologize again.  Be careful with Sandy Claws when you catch him!  Treat him nicely!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They scurry out the double doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally sits at a sewing machine, abjectly stitching Jack's Claus suit.  Finished with a long seam, she holds up the see how it's coming along... and shudders in its cheerful red glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If only he would come back to his senses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaking her head, she sets the suit back in place to stit another seam. But Sally is alone in her distress.  Beyond her -- the li Halloween factory gladly hums along making Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack supervises and approves as the residents of Hallowee busily manufacture the Halloween version of Christmas toy dolls, decorations, doing their well-intentioned best to the warmest, most magical Christmas yet.  The results of eager efforts, unbeknownst to them, often painfully miss mark: -- Barbie's a voodoo doll. -- The horrible-looking demon that springs from a Jack-In has a sweet decorative bow on it. -- Strings of electric lights are composed of tiny skulls which the colored lights gleam.

dialogues.speaker: MEANTIME,
dialogues.text: the Evil Scientist assembles Skeleton Reindeer from piles bones. He also takes the opportunity to assemble himself a new a improved Sally.  He animates her and she smiles at him. pleased.  She assists him in his work animating the reind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The factory looks like it was constructed by a master gin house maker, all dandy jigsaw angles and bulbous shapes a filigree.  There's a calendar that tells the NUMBER OF DA 'TIL CHRISTMAS -- it says ONE. At quaint conveyor belts, SANTA'S ELVES work their hardes -- Assembling the Christmas toys we most sentimentally as with Christmas, among them -- cherubic baby dolls in bonn gowns, gorgeously painted wooden rocking horses. -- Wrapping the beautiful gifts, colorful papers, elabora -- Labelling packages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa's team of sleigh-pulling reindeer practices roof ju techniques.  One YOUNG BUCK lands with a splat and must t again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. CLAUS putters in the kitchen while

dialogues.speaker: SANTA CLAUS
dialogues.text: sits in his big armchair in front of a roaring fire.  He checking a long list, checking it twice... when the

dialogues.speaker: DOORBELL
dialogues.text: rings. Setting aside his list, Santa hoists himself to his feet slowly crosses to the door.  He opens it and SEES

dialogues.speaker: LOCK, SHOCK
dialogues.text: crouched on his front stoop.  They cry their little bansh and leap up at his face with their sack wide open, baggin all goes BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HALLOWEENLAND TOWN SQUARE. CHRISTMAS EVE.
dialogues.text: The town has been festooned with "Christmas" decorations. Presents are being loaded into the coffin sleigh.  The Ev Scientist oversees the harnessing up of his skeleton rein He glowers over at

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: morosely helps Jack on with the red coat of his Santa Cla outfit.  He already wears the pants and boots.  Jack is positively thrilled with the costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfect!  It couldn't be more perfect!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack laughs -- his version of a booming laugh. Sally pulls out her needle to make a last minute adjustme one of the cuffs.  Then she sticks the needle back behind where it will be handy. Jack puts on his white beard and turns eagerly to check h

dialogues.speaker: REFLECTION
dialogues.text: in the polished black side of the coffin sleigh.  He grin himself... then, in a moment, his smile fades and he furr brow...  He peers closely at himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's missing... but what?  I've got the beard, the coat, the boots, the belt--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His musing is INTERRUPTED by the COMMOTION Lock, Shock & Barrel cause as they scuttle into view, out breath, struggling with their enormous sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time we bagged him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time we really did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sure is big, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And heavy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching Jack, they dump the sack and reveal the prize in untying the knot and peeling back the sides, uncovering t legendary Sandy Claws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy Claws!  Himself!  In person!  I can hardly believe it!  What a pleasure it is to meet you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa blinks.  Jack grabs his hand and shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, you have hands...  You don't have claws at all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa looks around to see where he has been brought.  He horror at the "Christmas" decorations everywhere, at the sleigh, at the reindeer, at the staring residents of Halloweenland, at Jack before him in what looks very much deflated version of his own outfit.  THE SHOCK RENDERS HI SPEECHLESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (delighted by Santa's reaction) Surprised, aren't you?  I knew you would be!  But you haven't seen anything yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pauses a beat for impact, then springs the good news

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to have another worry about Christmas this year.  Not a single care. We've seen to every detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa's eyes go wide and he begins to sputter -- searchin the words that could conceivably express the depths of hi feelings. Sally looks on, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider this a vacation, Sandy, a reward.  You've worked hard for a long time.  It's your turn to take it easy. Leave everything to me... You're going to be so pleased. You just relax and enjoy yourself while you're here. (to Lock, Shock & Barrel) See that he's comfortable, boys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock, Shock and Barrel grab ahold of Santa to drag him of but Jack stops them--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a second, fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack plucks the red cap off Santa's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course!  That's what I'm missing....  You don't mind if I borrow it, do you?  Thanks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops Santa's cap on his own head.  It is too big and d charmingly over one of Jack's big eye sockets.  He grins biggest grin yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chants softly to herself) There must be something... There must be something... There must be something I can do to stop him...  I know! I'll make him some tea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes off.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HALLOWEENLAND STREETS. CHRISTMAS EVE/A LITTLE LATER.
dialogues.text: Lock, Shock & Barrel strain to push/pull/haul/carry the astonished, still sputtering Santa Claus through town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're we taking him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Oogie Boogie's place, of course...  There isn't any place in the whole world more comfortable than that, is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, there isn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jack said to make him comfortable, didn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three gleefully giggle their hideous giggle.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TOWN SQUARE. CHRISTMAS EVE/LATER.
dialogues.text: The Mayor gives Jack the grandest possible Halloween send

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Think of us as you soar triumphantly through the sky, outshining any star, your silhouette a dark blot breaking the perfect circle of the moon...  We who are left behind here will surely be thinking of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands tall beside his sleigh.

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET BAND
dialogues.text: rattles a delicate "Jingle Bells."

dialogues.speaker: THE TOWNSPEOPLE
dialogues.text: look on proudly.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: hurries back with a steaming cup of her special sleeping- tea.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAYOR
dialogues.text: blabs on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You who are our pride; you who are our glory; you who have frightened millions into an early grave; you who have devastated --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His speech is SUDDENLY INTERRUPTED BY THE DESCENT OF A THICK HALLOWEEN FOG. The fog swirls around the assembled crowd.  It licks at t Mayor.  It threatens to engulf Jack, the sleigh, the skel reindeer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no...!

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: gazes about her in happy wonder.  The sight of the fog br wide, welcoming look of hope to her face. She dumps out the tea -- it eats a hole in the ground -- won't be needing it after all...

dialogues.speaker: THE FOG
dialogues.text: swallows everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never get the sleigh off the ground in this.  The reindeer can't see an inch in front of their noses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fog's as thick as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishes the thought) ...Jellied brains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (woe increasing) There go my hopes, my plans, my dreams... the tall-tales, the legends, the lies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a thin ghostly bark (O.S.) -- it belongs to Zero little jack o'lantern nose floats in... a tiny beacon pen the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dour and slow) There goes Christmas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (morose) No, Zero...  Not now...  Down, boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a long beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (has a sudden idea) Hey!  WAIT A MINUTE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR the sounds of RUMMAGING, of Jack MUTTERING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did I put that book...? I know it's in here somewhere...  Here it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR pages turned back and forth...  Then with charact melodramatic flourish Jack RECITES:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Zero with your nose so bright, Won't you guide my sleigh tonight?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barking, Zero swoops with pure joy. The crowd cheers. Zero floats to the front of the sleigh and takes position jack o'lantern nose glows brighter and brighter, soon illuminating the whole sleigh.  Jack leaps aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a crack of his skeleton whip, Jack and his ghostly e are instantly aloft.  In a moment, they are gone...

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: gapes into the swirling fog.  She stares miserably into t she emptied, then back up into the fog-choked sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Street Band materializes out of the fog.  They listen mournful song.  Moved, they accompany her.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STARRY, STARRY NIGHT. CHRISTMAS EVE.
dialogues.text: Jack's coffin sleigh whiplashes wildly through the glitte night sky -- a giddy, out of control amusement park ride. front of the sleigh, Zero exuberantly howls.

dialogues.speaker: FAR BELOW,
dialogues.text: peaceful little houses dot the landscape, innocently wait Christmas. Laughing his best booming Santa laugh, Jack begins his de

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SUBURBIA. CHRISTMAS EVE/LATER.
dialogues.text: The coffin sleigh CRASH LANDS on the roof of a little hou making such a racket that it wakes the sleeping family in the BABY CRIES BLOODY MURDER and we can HEAR the VOICE OF WIFE URGING HER HUSBAND TO INVESTIGATE. A big grin slashed across his face, Jack pops up out of t wreckage.  He gleefully slithers over to the chimney and inside.

dialogues.speaker: JACK'S SKELETAL HAND
dialogues.text: drops hideous little toys into the Christmas stockings hu along the fireplace mantelpiece.

dialogues.speaker: THE HYSTERICAL VOICES, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: continue: ("Get the gun!"  "We don't have a gun!"  "Well, something!").  As does the CRYING of the baby.  CLOSE BY:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweetly) Santa?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: spins around to see A LITTLE BOY STARING UP AT HIM.  At t of Jack, the little boy looks stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack springs over to the boy.  The little boy stands froz place.  The chaos (O.S.) persists:  ("Where is he?"  "He' his bed?"  "No!"  "Check downstairs."  "You check downsta Overhead, footsteps thump to and fro.  The baby still baw Jack bends down to the little boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy doesn't answer, doesn't move; he just keeps stari

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet I have a special present for you anyway!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack fishes into his big sack of toys.  He pulls a SHRUNK out by its hank of hair and hands it to the little boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go, sonny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a screeching "Ho, Ho, Ho," Jack springs back to the fireplace and WHOOSHES up the CHIMNEY to the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack leaps onto the remains of his coffin sleigh and off flies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still standing where Jack left him, the little boy stares morosely into the grotesque face of the Shrunken Head. (O.S.) Footsteps charge down the steps and pound down the the living room doorway -- both parents at once.  We HEAR horrified reactions, their BLOOD-CURDLING SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ROOFTOPS. CHRISTMAS EVE/LATER.
dialogues.text: Jack leaps nimbly from rooftop to rooftop -- merrily deli presents, blissfully unaware of the havoc he is creating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several residents of Halloweenland eagerly crowd around t witches' cauldron to watch Jack whose giddy journey above rooftops is reflected in the bubbling brew.  The gatherin and ahhhs and applauds. Sally is not among those watching.  A shriek of joy makes peek forlornly out from behind a distant building.  She p back out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: -- BOLTS ARE THROWN.
dialogues.text: -- TELEPHONES ARE DIALLED:  "Hello, Police?!" -- A BABY DOLL is cradled in the lap of a LITTLE GIRL.  F apparent reason, the baby doll's eyes SUDDENLY OPEN.  The girl shrieks and throws the doll off her lap. -- A MAN-EATING WREATH snakes off the door where it hangs sending out tentacles and tendrils that wrap around the L KISSING COUPLE, YANKING THEM CLEAR OFF THEIR FEET. -- A VAMPIRE TEDDY BEAR smiles as it totters across a roo -- THE TRACKS OF A MONSTROUS TOY TRAIN slither around a r chasing RETREATING CHILDREN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack gleefully continues delivering Christmas, mistaking irate screams and shaking fists of citizens below for gra He waves and calls:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU'RE WELCOME!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SEVERAL PHONES lined up on the SERGEANT'S DESK ring o hook.  We see the sergeant as a blue uniform, a big band. answers phone after phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the various telephones) Police station...  Where did you spot him?...  As fast as we can...  Police station...  I know, I know.  A skeleton. Where are you?...  Right... Just keep calm...  Turn off all the lights.  Make sure the doors are locked...  Hello? Police station...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. RADIO TOWER. CHRISTMAS EVE/LATER.
dialogues.text: The news broadcasts from a TALL RADIO TOWER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone parading as Santa Claus is ruining Christmas!... Reports are pouring in from all over the globe that an impostor is shamelessly impersonating Santa Claus and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally picks up the broadcast in the sewing needle she stu behind her ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- mocking and mangling this joyous holiday.  Gruesome nightmares have replaced the visions of sugarplums that should be dancing in our children's heads.  Whole families scream in terror.  The authorities assure us that, at this moment, the military is mobilizing to stop whoever it is that is perpetrating this heinous crime...  The monster must and will be stopped. Santa Claus! -- wherever you are.  Come back!  Come back and set things right!  The whole world is in a panic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing this, Sally too is in a panic.  She runs one way, the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to help Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa is behind bars, tied to a chair, in this dank, drip dark hell-hole that is Oogie Boogie's jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bellows) OUT!  LET ME OUT!  I'VE GOT TO GET OUT OF HERE NOW!  IT'S CHRISTMAS!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock, Shock & Barrel watch, giggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better be quiet, Sandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he doesn't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody knows about--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's interrupted by a FEARSOME GROANING (O.S.).  All thre little Trick or Treaters whip around at the sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They high-tail it out of there.  Oogie Boogie is on his w >>>>> OOGIE BOOGIE'S SONG. Oogie Boogie is an enormous shapeless sack, bulging with crawlies.  He rolls and oozes rather than walks. As Oogie Boogie's song concludes... a SHAPELY FEMALE LEG recognize as Sally's), wearing a high, high heel and expo to the garter, eases seductively into view outside the ja doorway. When there isn't an immediate reaction, the toe taps impa Oogie hears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and spots the beautifully turned leg.  The leg k can-can, once, twice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo la la...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He chuckles to himself and slathers.  Relishing the antic he rolls ever so slowly toward the enticement at the door leaving his prisoner completely behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meantime, the REST OF SALLY hops on her remaining leg aro outside of Boogie's jail to the BACK. She peeks through the tiny, barred window to SEE

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: where Santa Claus bucks in his chair, desperate to escape

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Sandy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whips around and is about to holler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts him off before he can yell) Ssh.  I'm here to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispered with all the force of shouting) Get me out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally reaches in through the bars, straining to touch San Claus.  He tries to move the chair toward her, but, try a might, he can't.  He is ready to burst with frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no use...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You discourage too easily. Just hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls off both her arms -- the left yanks the right o the socket, popping the stitches, and the right yanks the Santa swallows his scream of horror as Sally's unattached crawl through the bars and into the cell with him.

dialogues.speaker: ONE ARM
dialogues.text: scuttles to his ropes and begins picking at the knots whi

dialogues.speaker: OTHER ARM
dialogues.text: scoots out of the cell, behind Oogie Boogie -- who still toward the leg at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BIG GUNS fire into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far below, the guns fire.  Jack mistakes the artillery fo fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't that look fun, Zero?! They're celebrating!  They're thanking us for doing such a good job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero yaps happily and, nose in the air, swings gleefully forth in the harness at the head of the sleigh -- narrowl missing being blasted to smithereens by a well-guided MIS It was only the exuberant swinging that saved him.  His e goggle.  He bristles mid-air and begins to flail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls down) Whoa!  Careful down there, you guys!  That was a pretty close shave! (reassures Zero) It's okay, boy...  Head higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero regains control and flies up. The explosions below blast on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa's own hands are now free, attacking the rest of the that bind him while Sally's stray hand picks the lock on door.  In a moment, he is free.  In another moment, the d swings open. Grabbing Sally's arm, Santa lumbers out the door toward f Only Oogie Boogie himself stands in the way.

dialogues.speaker: OOGIE BOOGIE
dialogues.text: has just reached the door.  Sally's crawling hand has alm reached him. Making lascivious noises, Oogie Boogie peeks out to see w body that belongs to such a gorgeous leg might possibly l and is surprised to find nothing there... no body at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It dawns on him that he's been had.  Roaring, he wheels a only to see that Santa is loose and coming toward him.  H louder and starts forward to set things right when...

dialogues.speaker: SALLY'S HAND,
dialogues.text: the one that had been tailing him, leaps up and pulls the a thread on the sack that is Oogie Boogie's shapeless bod thread pulls out, LEAVING A GAPING OPENING IN OOGIE BOOGI Oogie Boogie wails as

dialogues.speaker: THE REST OF SALLY
dialogues.text: -- torso, head, one leg -- hops into view from around the

dialogues.speaker: SANTA
dialogues.text: grabs up Sally's arm still holding the string and is abou sweep up her other leg and the rest of her when there is

dialogues.speaker: SUDDEN ROAR
dialogues.text: behind him -- OOGIE BOOGIE RETURNED TO LIFE.  The empty b up and with the SUCTION from hell SUCKS SANTA AND SALLY i BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and his ghostly team now frantically but successfull a barrage of missiles... only in the next instant to suff DIRECT HIT and

dialogues.speaker: EXPLODE
dialogues.text: The explosion is huge, fiery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explosion is being simulcast to the group of Hallowee townspeople in the witches' cauldron. They gape at the fireball in confusion and disbelief. The Mayor turns away... ever the politician... his two fa compete to be the first to speak -- one of them wins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew this Christmas thing was a bad idea...  I had a feeling in my bones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor climbs aboard his hearse and is driven off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clutching a burning bag of toys, Jack falls.  He holds on Zero -- who turns into a whimpering parachute. Jack, voice choked, cries out in anguished sincerity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas to all and to all a good night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack lets go of Zero and plummets toward earth. EXT. CEMETERY. CHRISTMAS EVE/CONTINUOUS TIME. Jack lands hard, bones clattering.  Zero floats down besi

dialogues.speaker: INT. OOGIE BOOGIE'S JAIL. CHRISTMAS EVE/A LITTLE LATER.
dialogues.text: Santa and Sally (more or less stuck together again) are c by Oogie Boogie -- he is in the process of snatching the parts of himself out of the air and stuffing them back in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what am I going to do with you two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try anything and you just wait 'til Jack gets back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MAYOR'S HEARSE passes (O.S.) -- blaring the announcem

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack has been blown to smithereens.  Christmas is over.  Skeleton Jack is no more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oogie Boogie chuckles.  He leers at Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a squiggly something and shoves it back into his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a long time, Jack doesn't move.  He lies flat, sprawl down across a couple of tombstones.  Finally, he hauls hi on a large stone cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice weak) I thought I could be Santa.  I thought I could be better than Santa.  And what did I do instead?  Instead I killed Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crumpling, Jack weeps.  Zero, ever faithful, makes himsel hankie and wipes Jack's wet eyes. >>>>> JACK'S SADDEST OF SAD SONGS. Jack sings as if his heart had broken in two.  He is at h lowest of lows.  Yet, being Jack, being irrepressibly buo the end of the song, he has completely worked himself bac from grief very nearly to exuberance -- he must save Sant must restore Christmas as it should be! He opens a tombstone, lifting it up as easily as if it we door to a storm cellar and, filled with determination, ru down toward Halloweenland.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OOGIE BOOGIE'S JAIL. CHRISTMAS EVE/LATER.
dialogues.text: Santa and Sally dangle perilously above a PIT.  They've b bound and gagged and they writhe in terror. From the murky depths below, SKELETON CROCODILES leap up jaws snapping hungrily.  Watching, Oogie Boogie snickers. lowers Santa and Sally closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrawny ol' things -- they haven't eaten in centuries. I'd say it's about time we put some meat on their bones, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, there's a

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: behind him -- the crash of the door being kicked in. And there stands JACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sweeps Boogie off his feet and holds him above the p himself.  Immediately, the terrorizer is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack!  How great to see you. We were all worried about you. I was just giving our guests here a... a tour of the place. I told them it was dangerous, but they insisted on a closer look.  What could I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the whole show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dumps Oogie Boogie over the edge, but delicately keeps of a choice thread. AS HE FALLS, OOGIE BOOGIE UNRAVELS COMPLETELY. His insides escape into the dark -- with the sounds of wi flapping and feet skittering -- and, IN THE END, ALL THAT OF HIS SHAPELESS SACK OF A BODY IS ONE LONG THREAD. In the pit below, the crocodile skeletons scoot around, j clapping, having themselves a feast.

dialogues.speaker: LATER,
dialogues.text: Jack finishes untying Santa and Sally.  He works quickly. ungags Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with glad relief) We heard you'd been pulverized to bone dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what I did, I deserve to be bone dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks away from Santa's angry gaze.  He takes off Sa cap and replaces it on Santa's head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where it belongs...  I was only trying to do a good job, but I made a real mess of everything.  I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cringing, he unties Santa's gag.  Santa scowls and straig his cap but, rather than chastise Jack, immediately makes door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time to talk now...  I've got to go fix Christmas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa charges off.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HALLOWEENLAND STREET. CHRISTMAS EVE/LATER.
dialogues.text: Various townspeople duck out of the way to avoid Jack -- stopped to gaze up into the empty night sky.  Zero floats him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it's not too late for him to set Christmas right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sighs and drags himself up the deserted street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Zero... I guess it's just you and me... (the thought dawns) ...And Sally.  She sure stuck by us, didn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downcast as he stalks along, Jack doesn't notice when it to SNOW. At first, just a few sparkling flakes fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It snows more and more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White thing's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everywhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could it be --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishes the thought) -- SNOW??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero barks excitedly.  Jack finally looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with wonder) It is snow...  But how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if in answer to Jack's question we HEAR

dialogues.speaker: SANTA'S BOOMING HO-HO-HO
dialogues.text: high up in the sky. A SLOW SMILE SPREADS ACROSS JACK'S FACE. The residents of Halloween come out to experience the sno this miracle of Christmas that has come to Halloween.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack joins in the celebration -- but seems always to be l around for someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the celebrating goes on in town below, Sally climbs Ce Hill.  Sitting down at the top, she looks out at the roun which shines behind the curtain of falling snow.  She is sing a brief reprise of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon, A SECOND VOICE joins in, making the song a DUET.  T second voice belongs to JACK. He has found Sally. Jack sings:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dearest friend, if you don't mind I'd like to join you by your side Let's sit together, you and I Alone, where we can watch the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits beside her.  Together they look out at the moon a snow.

dialogues.speaker: WE PULL BACK AND UP
dialogues.text: Above the CLOUDS and the SNOW, past SANTA flying into the distance aboard his sleigh, above the gleaming light of t Christmas MOON, and into the NIGHT, pulling BACK AND BACK THE STARS... Santa's voice returns to narrate:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally, everything worked out just fine -- Christmas was saved, though there wasn't much time. But, after that night, things were never the same, Each holiday now knew the other one's name. And so when their long isolation had ended, They cautiously reached out, and slowly befriended. And each shared a bit of the things that they had With each other, and found out it wasn't so bad -- They had snowflakes in Halloween, those we could spare, And we here in Christmas enjoyed a few scares. The fireworks gave the Easter Bunnies a thrill And St. Patrick's Day cherishes Easter Eggs still. And though that one Christmas, things got out of hand, I'm still rather fond of that skeleton man. Though misguided I think his intentions were good. He was just a poor skeleton misunderstood. So many years later I thought I'd drop in, And there was old Jack, still looking quite thin. With four or five skeleton children at hand Playing strange little tunes in their xylophone band. And I asked old Jack, 'Do you remember the night, When the sky was so dark, and the moon shone so bright? 'When a million small children pretending to sleep Nearly didn't have Christmas at all, so to speak? 'And would, if you could, turn that mighty clock back To that long fateful night?  Now, think carefully, Jack. 'Would you do the whole thing all over again? Knowing what you know now, knowing what you knew then?' And he smiled like the old Pumpkin King that I knew, Then turned, and asked softly of me... 'Wouldn't you?'
